instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

History:
problem with PP3v42 and water damage.


I fixed the problem and put the board into ultrasonic cleaning and after the ultrasonic cleaning, the board doesn't work.

I have:
PP3v42 = 3.42v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
PPVRTC = 3.3v


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> = Missing!!! 0v

Checking <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> now.. But cant find anything? Yet!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Did you use sweep function of UC machine?

Check the board for knocked off components and broken traces.
UC machine just removes corrosion, doesn't rebuild corroded traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: UC it again and dry it properly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Tmr I will buy some new ultrasonic cleaning. To be fair. I had some ultrasonic cleaning inside that might have been old, and i happen to mix it with Isopropanol.. haha.. I know.. Its pretty dumb thing to do.. 

1. So i guess thats part of it. However I will take John advice and try ultrasonic it again with new cleaning tmr. 

2. Will sweep the UC as well for spareparts that might have come off.  

Thanks guys, you guys are the best.  I revert back here tmr with news.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Use distilled water adding proper cleaning liquid, no IPA.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Yes as 2informaticos said distilled only and cleaning solution recommend Branson EC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Problem is solved gents.. Someone mentioned issued with <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>. so I started there and traced back. 

Was missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5</SIGNAL> rail as well. So i continue tracing back

It was <CHIP>U8020</CHIP> (<CHIP>TPS22924</CHIP>) Missing 3v output voltage. It had <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> input and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS_EN</SIGNAL> input.  

[B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL] and [URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/1153-johnb8812"]JohnB8812[/URL] [/B]Thanks for replying back. Enjoy your weeekend
